intro: Halophila linearis, commonly known as the slender halophyte, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is a seagrass species that thrives in shallow, coastal waters with high salinity. The plant has long, narrow leaves that are typically ribbon-like in shape, adapted for efficient photosynthesis in aquatic environments. It plays a crucial role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms. Halophila linearis is also important for carbon sequestration and coastal ecosystem health.
